comments.body: I believe the `build` section only needs `python` and `pip`. The others aren't necessary to actually build the package.

This is failing since it looks like only a `.whl` is provided on pypi:

https://pypi.org/project/bamnostic/#files

There are no releases on github to grab the source from. Perhaps engage the maintainer in adding a source distribution? My sense from comments on another recent PR is that we really prefer to build these from source.

Yes, apologies, I should have written more clearly that this PR is designed to show the package maintainer how to submit a `conda-forge` recipe. I met him at PyCon, and he was angling to build the conda-forge package, so I decided to show him on the spot, and have him added as a recipe maintainer. (I figured with regro bot, maintenance is going to be much easier nowadays.)
I've cc'd @betteridiot because he will go back and update the PyPI release with a tarball, and then update the version number and file hash.
